Description: Part of body of translucent white and yellow-brown calcite jar with banding cut horizontally: an Egyptian vessel with part of an engraved Egyptian hieroglyphic inscription with name and title of "Xerxes Great King" enclosed in a vertical cartouche; exterior polished.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Susa, Found in the northern part of the citadel mound.
Bibliographic references: Searight, Reade & Finkel 2008a / Assyrian Stone Vessels and related material in the British Museum (276, p.34, fig.17)
Curtis & Tallis 2005 / Forgotten Empire: The world of Ancient Persia (cat. 145, p. 129)
Curtis 1993a / William Kennett Loftus and his excavations at Susa (E.82, p.27, pls.11b (upper left) and 19a)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006 7 Mar-11 Jun, Barcelona, Fundacion La Caixa, 'L'imperi Oblidat' 2005-2006 Sept-Jan, London, BM, 'Forgotten Empire' 1995-2005, 17 Nov-Dec, BM, G52/IRAN/8, no.8 Persian Room, wall-case [WC] 15, top shelf Babylonian & Assyrian Room, wall-cases 28-29 (1900 Guide)
Condition: Fair; incomplete; part of body only.
